definition: to reopen/to start again
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: They are thinking to open another Lucky Express in this street.
sentences.chinese: 他們打算在這條街上再開一家樂凱快印店。

sentences.english: I take the next left turn to the stop sign.
sentences.chinese: 我在下個路口左轉彎，到一個停車再開標誌處。

sentences.english: The only time any peripherals go on is when I use them, too, like the printer.
sentences.chinese: 外設什麼的用的時候再開，比如打印機。

sentences.english: She bought several clothes shops and prepared to build up a chain.
sentences.chinese: 她盤下了幾家服裝店，並且打算再開一家新的分店。

in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
to begin/beginning/to start/initial/CL:個|个[ge4]

to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute
